fullText: “MJ” is a jukebox musical that is nothing but the late King of Pop’s greatest hits. Would Jackson himself approve of such a sentimental journey? More to the point is that his estate has approved it. And that is only one of the minor offenses on display in “MJ,” which opened Tuesday at Broadway’s Neil Simon Theatre.

keyPhrases.quote: that is only one of the minor offenses on display in "MJ"
a jukebox musical that is nothing but the late King of Pop's greatest hits
nothing but the late King of Pop’s greatest hits

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The critic describes the show as having 'minor offenses on display' and dismissively characterizes it as 'nothing but' greatest hits, indicating clear disapproval despite the brief excerpt. | GPT-4o-mini: The review expresses significant criticism of the musical's reliance on nostalgia and questions its artistic integrity, indicating a clear negative stance.
